meta.description: The kind Winter Fair strives to intersect cannabis, culture, and kindness.

title: A Toronto Nightclub Recently Celebrated The Culture Of Cannabis In One Exciting Evening
cleaned_text:
Kind is Canada’s leading cannabis magazine, featuring weed, arts, food health, travel, and more. The magazine prints four editions every year, which sums up to 130,000 copies distributed throughout the country to more than 550 legal cannabis retailers. For more information, take a look at kind’s Instagram and website.

Speaking on The kind Winter Fair, Joshua Nagel, kind founder and publisher, noted in a press release that his company’s mission has always been to help push “the intersection of cannabis, culture, and kindness.” He said his magazine is proud to shine a light on the best people and experiences the cannabis industry offers.

The company also hosts the kind Awards, a celebration of cannabis culture and industry players selected by 233 budtenders across Canada. For this year’s 2021 kind Awards, Nagel said the industry needed a “scorecard determined by budtenders on the frontlines, not brand bucks.”
